isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Place the larger low range synchronizer ring on the bench. Cover the assembly with a shop rag to prevent losing the three springs released from the high range synchronizer at the pin locations. Pull the high range synchronizer from the blocker pins ( Figure 163).

figure.caption: Figure 163. Pull High Range Synchronizer From Blocker Pins

step1.para: Remove the sliding clutch from the synchronizer ring low range pins ( Figure 164).

figure.caption: Figure 164. Remove Sliding Clutch From Synchronizer Ring Low Range Pins

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies (8-Speed "LL" Models)

step1.para: Remove the bearing inner spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 165).

figure.caption: Figure 165. Remove Bearing Inner Spacer From Output Shaft

step1.para: Use the front face of the deep reduction gear as a base and press the output shaft through the bearing and gear ( Figure 166). This frees the bearing, gear, washer, and, for models so equipped, the spacer or oil retention ring. DO NOT DAMAGE MAINSHAFT QUILL.

figure.caption: Figure 166. Press Output Shaft Through Bearing and Gear

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the deep reduction gear of models so equipped ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. Remove Snap Ring of I.D. of Deep Reduction Gear

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies (9-Speed and RT-8608 Models)

step1.para: Remove the bearing inner spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Remove Bearing Inner Spacer From Output Shaft

step1.para: Use the front face of the low range gear as a base and press the output shaft through the bearing and gear ( Figure 169). Remove the bearing and washer from the hub of the low range gear.

figure.caption: Figure 169. Press Output Shaft Through Bearing and Gear

step1.para: If necessary, remove the snap ring from the low range gear of models so equipped ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Remove Snap Ring From Low Range Gear

step1.para: Remove the splined spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 171).

figure.caption: Figure 171. Remove Splined Spacer From Output Shaft

step1.para: Remove the stepped washer from the shaft of models so equipped ( Figure 172).

Remove the bolts, rear bearing cover and gasket ( Figure 173). The bearing cone will drop from the bore in the auxiliary plate when cover is removed. If necessary, remove the oil seal from the cover ( inset, Figure 173).

figure.caption: Figure 172. Remove Bolts, Rear Bearing Cover, Gasket, and Oil Seal

step1.para: Remove the two bearing cups and outer spacer from the bore in the auxiliary plate ( Figure 174).

figure.caption: Figure 173. Remove Bearing Cups and Outer Spacer

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies (13-Speed Models)

step1.para: Remove the bearing inner spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 175).

figure.caption: Figure 174. Remove Bearing Inner Spacer From Output Shaft

step1.para: Using the front face of the splitter gear as a base, press the output shaft through the bearing, washer and gear ( Figure 176). DO NOT DAMAGE THE MAINSHAFT QUILL. If necessary, remove the snap ring from the I.D. of the splitter gear ( inset, Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 175. Press Output Shaft Through Bearing, Washer and Gear, and Remove Snap Ring

step1.para: Remove the retaining bolts, rear bearing cover and gasket from the auxiliary housing ( Figure 177). The rear bearing cone will drop from the housing bore when the cover is removed. If necessary, remove the oil seal from the cover ( inset, Figure 177).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Remove Bolts, Rear Bearing Cover, Gasket, and Oil Seal

step1.para: Remove the two bearing cups and outer spacer from the housing bore ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 177. Remove Bearing Cups and Outer Spacer
